item.title: Windows 11 22H2: Everything we know so far
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: Windows 11 version 22H2 aka Sun Valley 2 is set to launch later this year. Unlike the original Windows 11 release, it won't be a massive update with radical design changes. Instead, Sun Valley 2 will be similar to Windows 10 Anniversary Update, so you can expect minor improvements and a few new features. [...]

item.title: Hive ransomware ports its Linux VMware ESXi encryptor to Rust
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: The Hive ransomware operation has converted their VMware ESXi Linux encryptor to the Rust programming language and added new features to make it harder for security researchers to snoop on victim's ransom negotiations. [...]

item.title: Critical Sophos Firewall vulnerability allows remote code execution
item.dc:creator: Ax Sharma
item.description: Sophos has fixed a critical vulnerability in its Sophos Firewall product that allows remote code execution. Tracked as CVE-2022-1040, the authentication bypass vulnerability exists in the User Portal and Webadmin areas of Sophos Firewall. [...]

item.title: Okta: "We made a mistake" delaying the Lapsus$ hack disclosure
item.dc:creator: Ax Sharma
item.description: Okta has admitted that it made a mistake delaying the disclosure of hack from the Lapsus$ data extortion group that took place in January. Additionally, the company has provided a detailed timeline of the incident and its investigation activities. [...]

item.title: CISA adds 66 vulnerabilities to list of bugs exploited in attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has added a massive set of 66 actively exploited vulnerabilities to its catalog of 'Known Exploited Vulnerabilities.' [...]

item.title: Western Digital fixes critical bug giving root on My Cloud NAS devices
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Western Digital has fixed a critical severity vulnerability in the Samba vfs_fruit VFS module that enabled attackers to gain remote code execution with root privileges on unpatched My Cloud OS 5 devices. [...]

item.title: US says Kaspersky poses unacceptable risk to national security
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The Federal Communications Commission (FCC) added Russian cybersecurity firm Kaspersky to its Covered List, saying it poses unacceptable risks to U.S. national security. [...]

item.title: The Week in Ransomware - March 25th 2022 - Critical infrastructure
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: With the US providing military aid to Ukraine and its sanctions damaging the Russian economy, the US government disclosed this week that there is intelligence that Russia is preparing for potential cyberattacks against US interests. [...]

item.title: Emergency Google Chrome update fixes zero-day used in attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Google has released Chrome 99.0.4844.84 for Windows, Mac, and Linux users to address a high-severity zero-day bug exploited in the wild. [...]

item.title: Public Redis exploit used by malware gang to grow botnet
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Threat analysts report having spotted a change in the operations of the Muhstik threat group, which has now switched to actively exploiting a Lua sandbox escape flaw in Redis. [...]

item.title: Racoon Stealer malware suspends operations due to war in Ukraine
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: The cybercrime group behind the development of the Racoon Stealer password-stealing malware has suspended its operation after claiming that one of its developers died in the invasion of Ukraine. [...]

item.title: Estonian ransomware operator sentenced to 66 months in prison
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Maksim Berezan, an Estonian man linked to multimillion-dollar ransomware attacks, was sentenced on Friday to 66 months in prison for his involvement in online fraud schemes. [...]

item.title: HackerOne kicks Kaspersky’s bug bounty program off its platform
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Bug bounty platform HackerOne disabled Kaspersky's bug bounty program on Friday following sanctions imposed on Russia and Belarus after the invasion of Ukraine. [...]
